title-part.text: HAND-PROPELLED VEHICLES, e.g. HAND CARTS, PERAMBULATORS

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the term "hand carts" also embraces hand-propelled wheeled devices in so far as the features thereof are generic to hand carts. This term also embraces pedestrian-controlled power-driven vehicles in so far as the features thereof are generic to hand carts
Rollers are taken as being equivalent to wheels

The following IPC groups are not used in the internal CPC classsification scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups :
B62B3/065 covered by B62B3/06B4

title-part.text: Hand carts having only one axis carrying one or more transport wheels

CPC-specific-text.text: convertible from a one-axled vehicle to a two-axled vehicle
being longitudinally nestable with each other
being vertically stackable with each other
having a prop or stand for maintaining position

title-part.text: in which the wheel axis is disposed between the load and the handles
involving parts being adjustable, collapsible, attachable, detachable, or convertible

CPC-specific-text.text: by telescopic movement of the handle

title-part.text: involving means for grappling or securing in place objects to be carried
having auxiliary wheels used during loading or unloading
in which the load is intended to be transferred totally to the wheels
involving parts being adjustable, collapsible, attachable, detachable, or convertible
involving means for grappling or securing in place objects to be carried

CPC-specific-text.text: with object clamping means being movable substantially parallel to the ground surface
Unloading equipment for pushing the load from the carrier platform
the load support being in the form of a scoop

title-part.text: in which the load is disposed between the wheel axis and the handles, e.g. wheelbarrows

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising an additional wheel, e.g. mounted on the struts

title-part.text: involving parts being collapsible, attachable, detachable or convertible

CPC-specific-text.text: Detachable elements on the buckets, e.g. for increasing volume
and capable of being completely disassembled

title-part.text: involving means for grappling or securing in place objects to be carried
characterised by supports specially adapted to objects of definite shape

CPC-specific-text.text: the objects being of elongated shape, e.g. fishing rods, golf clubs
the objects being of cylindrical shape, e.g. barrels, buckets, dustbins
the objects being plates, doors, panels or the like

title-part.text: Hand carts having more than one axis carrying transport wheels

reference.text: convertible from one-axled to two-axled vehicle B62B1/002

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by a rectangular shape, involving sidewalls or racks
Details of doors or cover lids
Details of storage means, e.g. drawers, bins or racks
for stacking objects like trays, bobbins, chains

title-part.text: involving parts being adjustable, collapsible, attachable, detachable or convertible

CPC-specific-text.text: folding down the body to the wheel carriage or by retracting projecting parts

reference.text: collapsible containers B65D, e.g. B65D7/24 , B65D9/12 , B65D11/18

title-part.text: involving means for grappling or securing in place objects to be carried
for simply clearing the load from the ground

reference.text: masted lift trucks B66F

CPC-specific-text.text: using rigid mechanical lifting mechanisms, e.g. levers, cams or gears
using flexible mechanical lifting mechanisms, e.g. ropes or chains
the wheels remaining stationary while the supporting surface is lifted

title-part.text: characterised by supports specially adapted to objects of definite shape

CPC-specific-text.text: the objects being of elongated shape, e.g. rods or golf clubs
the object being of cylindrical shape, e.g. barrels, buckets, dustbins
the objects being plates, doors, panels, or the like

title-part.text: characterised by provisions for nesting or stacking, e.g. shopping trolleys

reference.text: collapsible shopping trolleys B62B3/027

CPC-specific-text.text: Means for facilitating stowing or transporting of the trolleys; Antitheft arrangements

reference.text: B62B5/0423 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: Display devices mounted on it, e.g. advertisement displays
Adaptations for calculators, memory aids or reading aids
Covers, e.g. for protection in rain
Adaptations for transporting children; Mounting of toys for the children
Transporting devices mounted on the shopping cart
Lockers, hooks e.g. for personal belongings
Bags or containers specially adapted to the baskets

Adaptations facilitating the transport to the counter
by an auxiliary access to the inside of the basket
Indicating or preventing transport of goods under the basket

title-part.text: nestable by means of pivoted supports or support parts, e.g. baskets

reference.text: B62B3/1476 takes precedence

title-part.text: Accessories or details specially adapted for hand carts

reference.text: , B62B9/00 take precedence; wheels, axles, or axle bearing for vehicles B60B; castors for vehicles, castors in general B60B33/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Adaptations for loading in or on a vehicle
Stops for moving parts, e.g. rubber elements to eliminate stop noise
Adaptations for moving the carts by wheel chair users or other disabled persons
Arrangements for carrying as a back-pack
facilitating hand propulsion when motor fails
Towing by connecting to another vehicle
Wheeled supports connected to the transported object
arranged independently on either side of the transported load
Lifting lever on wheels or rollers
Flat dollys without hand moving equipment
Identification of the cart or merchandise, e.g. by barcodes or radio frequency identification (RFID)

title-part.text: providing for travelling up or down a flight of stairs

reference.text: chairs or multi-track cycles specially adapted for invalids A61G5/00

CPC-specific-text.text: braking or blocking when leaving a particular area
braking when supported on a transport belt
using elements cooperating with a handle bar
by locking in a braking position
by turning the wheels in different directions, e.g. toe-in
by braking on the running surface, e.g. the tyre
locking against movement by contacting the floor or a wall

title-part.text: Hand moving equipment, e.g. handle bars

reference.text: for cycles B62K11/14 , B62K21/12

adaptable for different users, e.g. by means of pivoting elements
Handle bars rotatable about their longitudinal axis
Connections to the body for moving the cart, e.g. harnesses
Removable sleeves on handle bars, e.g. for protection against germs

reference.text: B62B3/14 takes precedence

reference.text: chairs or multi-track cycles specially adapted for invalids A61G5/00
when detachable or rotatable B62B7/145

having more than one wheel axis

the handle bar being parallel to the front leg
the handle bar moves in parallel relation during folding

the user being hanging in a harness

title-part.text: Indexing codes relating to type or characteristics of transported articles
Cylindrically-shaped articles, e.g. drums, barrels, flasks
Beverage holders, e.g. for a cup, tin or bottle
Reels, e.g. for filamentary or sheet material
Persons or animals, dead or alive
Tiles, bricks, paving slabs or the like
Household appliances, e.g. bath tubs, toilets or radiators

reference.text: characterised by animal propulsion B62C ; propulsion of sledges by driver or engine B62M

title-part.text: pivotally, e.g. for keeping it horizontally
Rocking means for facilitating tilting of the cart, e.g. by loading
Comprising a moving platform or the like, e.g. for unloading
turning around a vertical pivot axis
the objects being supported between the tines
the fork comprising more than two tines
Changing the position of the fork or supports
the fork being independent from the supporting arms in which the wheels are incorporated
Guiding the forks into the pallets
Stops on the tines to arrest the pallets or other objects
Supporting bins or barrels by their handgrips or other protrusions
Grips for grasping the upper rim of the barrels
Positioning, means on a cart for loads
Comprising means for facilitating loading or unloading
means for pushing or pulling the load from/onto the platform
Hand-propelled vehicles or sledges being foldable or dismountable when not in use
with actuation mechanisms which drive the folding or unfolding operation
stowed on top of each other
Detachable wheel units, e.g. together with the wheel shaft
stowed on top of each other
retractable in the direction of the shaft, e.g. with telescopic shafts
remotely controlled, e.g. from the handlebar
to hold in the folded position
Arrangements for standing up in folded position
Detachable, retractable or collapsible load supporting means
Adjustable or convertible hand-propelled vehicles or sledges
with actuation mechanisms which drive the adjustment or conversion operation
only the load support being adjustable
Joining hand-propelled vehicles or sledges together
comprising wheels for longitudinal travelling and wheels for lateral travelling
comprising a wheel pivotable about a substantially vertical axis, e.g. swivelling castors
arranged remote from the longitudinal centreline of the hand propelled vehicle
with means restricting the rotation about that axis
by blocking the rotation at a position
by urging the wheel into a position, e.g. into a straight forward position
combined with means for braking the wheel
Details of the attachment of the wheel assembly to the chassis
comprising additional wheels to increase stability
Adjusting the position of the wheel axles to increase stability
comprising counterbalancing means to increase stability
the wheel arrangement pivoting around a horizontal-longitudinal axis
the pressure of the wheel on the ground being controlled, e.g. by the load or the wheel slip
characterised by the ground engaging elements, e.g. wheel type
Wheels provided with protrusions, e.g. anti-slip protrusions
Protection against mud, e.g. by retracting or enclosing the wheels
